root: ^You find a discarded journal deep into one of the mineshafts. Whoever left this, must have done so recently.

^You brush off the sand from the leather binding and notice a very unique seal that matches the sigil found on the banner back in the swamp. It looks like this could be the Champion's personal journal.

chapter1: ^"...this has to be some kind of joke. Me, the 'Dawnbringer'? I've never even heard of this prophecy..."

^"... as we prepare to leave, I had to remind the consul; only those closest to me - my bannerman Everard and the Priestess Viola - are allowed to follow. They at least, know there might be no way back from where we are going..."
chapter2: ^"...if some puffed up priests want me to be their hero, I'll do it on my own terms. Not because some prophecy or priest tells me to. I will end this - once and for all..."
chapter3: ^"...they never told me when they said 'hero' they meant 'sacrifice'. Charging headfirst into an army of demons. These priests have the strategic mind of a Toadbelcher."

^In the entry of the book, the writing seems to get more and more frantic. "If I am this 'Dawnbringer', I will take the battle straight to the very heart of their evil and vanquish it once and for all..."
leave: ^"Reading about this... about him. It seems like a lifetime ago. The Light only knows how long I've been down here..."

c-8: ^"We were heading into the Black Cathedral itself. Corellion - the Dawnbringer, he had located a route into that dark palace itself, sensing a great evil within."
c-9: ^"I have no memory of getting captured. This is one of Rae's blessings to be sure, [[class]]. I thank you for freeing me from this nightmare, but I fear my trials have not come to an end yet. I will see this through."

c-0: ^"The naivety of these Candorians never fails to impress me... Trials - bwah! Self-righteous bedtime stories more like."
